newsitem.title: UK: GEO Interactive seeks admission to London's AIM.
newsitem.headline: GEO Interactive seeks admission to London's AIM.

text.p: Israeli-based GEO Interactive Media Group Ltd, which develops Internet software, said on Monday it was seeking admission to the Alternative Investment Market (AIM) in London in the autumn.

The flotation will be via a placing to UK institutional investors, with Price Waterhouse Corporate Finance acting as adviser and Panmure Gordon as broker, also responsible for underwriting the placing.
Among its products are Emblaze, which provides multimedia content delivery over the Internet and interactive products for delivery on CD-ROM.
In a statement, GEO said it was founded in 1994, with most of its founders and technicians coming from the advanced technology development unit of the Israel Defence Forces.
That unit specialised in simulators,, virtual combat zones and encryption techniques.
